Instruction: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sautï¿½ the onions until they are browned; remove from the pot and set aside. Add the ground beef to the pot and cook until browned evenly. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the browned onions and cook on high heat for 3 to 5 minutes. Mix in 1 cup of water. Reduce heat, cover, and let simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in ketchup, beef broth, and teriyaki sauce. Season with pepper, curry powder, garlic powder, and onion powder. Cover and simmer for about 2 hours.
In a large bowl, combine the rice, tomatoes, black beans, corn, garlic, onion, lime juice, and seasonings; mix well.
